Star Question mark
$ ?
Cash cow Dog
High Low
Relative market share Relative market share
summary_markdown: This table presents a two-by-two matrix, the Boston Consulting Group (BCG) Growth-Share Matrix, used for strategic portfolio analysis. The matrix categorizes business units or products based on two dimensions: relative market share (horizontal axis) and market growth rate (vertical axis). The upper-left quadrant, labeled "Star," represents high market share and high market growth. The upper-right quadrant, labeled "Question mark," signifies low market share and high market growth. The lower-left quadrant, termed "Cash cow," indicates high market share and low market growth. Finally, the lower-right quadrant, designated as "Dog," represents low market share and low market growth. This structure facilitates decisions regarding resource allocation and strategic planning for different business units.
